answers.answer: Hello - I am a Human Resource Manager. I recommend that you talk to your physician about your concerns. You may be able to modify your current role to accommodate your pregnancy. It depends on what you feel you can or can not do and is signed off on by your doctor. Your employer should have some forms called a request for accommodation form. You can also let your manager know your concerns.

Only u know whats best for you n ur baby. I was in a similar situation and im 23 weeks. The doctors pulled me from work already bc my baby is small and i was putting to much stress on her. My bp was all over the place n got stress rashes. Was already showing signs of preeclampsia before 5m months due to the stress.
Thank you I have an appointment next week and I will bring it up.
Wow...I don't wish for anyone to go through that. Glad you were pulled at the right time. Thank you for input.
Yes cause they said if i continue working im going to barely make it to 34 weeks. I had to think about my baby and not my job. But Good Luck! Hope everything works out for you

question: So my current job is super highly stressful with meeting high demands and daily physical activity. I work as a door to door sales person and my question is more towards the h.r. route of can I apply or ask to be transferred into another position because of the stress I'm under be use of my current position. My bf and I both do the same job he wants me to stick it out but I don't want to risk losing the baby I'm at 10 wks. I just got back from carpal tunnel work injury and I'm just trying to focus on having enough energy to last the day and ease my mind to sleep. By the way all symptoms are full blown and some days making it impossible to work.
title: H.R. work being pregnant
